alert.note: Alert for Hancock; McDonough (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 2:17AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern McDonough and southeastern Hancock Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 217 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Point, or 8 miles southwest of Carthage, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carthage, Hamilton, Colchester, Bowen, West Point, Tennessee, Colmar, Plymouth, Denver, Fountain Green, Elvaston, Basco, Bentley and Webster. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
